website_summaries.verdict: A basic option with a mid-level price. Ideal for consumers who are looking for an alternative to wrist-strap models.
pros: A versatile monitor that's ideal for health and athletic purposes
Can be worn with a lanyard
cons: Fairly basic, and not as versatile as others on our list

customer_reviews.title: Way off
customer_reviews.text: This device is reading on average 5% low. I am a full time hospice caregiver and had to call their nurse to bring tested regulated equipment over to check. This device is either defective or not up to the standards you are claiming.
customer_reviews.author: Buddhabear

customer_reviews.title: is excellent. She told me that her medical support personnel ...
customer_reviews.text: My 92 year-old mom wanted one to monitor her oxygen level -- which, by the way, is excellent. She told me that her medical support personnel recommended that she purchase the oximeter on Amazon and nowhere else!!! I got it for her and she loves it. As for the medical personnel, their jaws dropped when they saw it. It's an excellent monitor and it arrived two days early. I've always loved shopping on Amazon and now my mom does too!!! Yay!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Essential (maybe) for EMS providers
customer_reviews.text: I am an EMT and I just got it. I have yet to utilize it. But where I work, we are expected to have an SpO2 reading of our patients during transport. I used to have to rely on others (fellow EMTs) who had the pulse ox or my paramedic partner who would have a monitor where we would have to get a baseline reading. Update 6/15/2018 Have used it many times and it has come in very handy especially if I am transferring care to an EMS crew and they want to know what the SpO2 reading is.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect device
customer_reviews.text: We needed this to keep track of oxygen saturation levels for my mother. After hospitalization, we wanted to be sure she did not need to be on oxygen at home! This makes us confident that she is breathing like she should!
customer_reviews.author: Julana Harmon

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for the past week, with ease. It is extremely user-friendly, easy to read and understand, lightweight. Comes with full instructions including good guide for use/misuse. My sense is that it is pretty accurate, as well. I intend to take it with me for my next MD visit to see how it accords with the oximeter the office uses. As to the seller: on-time delivery and the item just as described. A good value.
customer_reviews.author: ReadingGaol

customer_reviews.title: Works well with A-fib:
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble with these working correctly because of my a-fib. This one seems to work better than others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Got this so my mom could monitor her oxygen rate ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this so my mom could monitor her oxygen rate (pulmonologist wanted her to be on oxygen 24/7). Based on daily testing with this device, we are confident that mom's O2 rate is stable/high enough that she does not need to deal with oxygen tanks at this late stage in her life (she's 91).
customer_reviews.author: sobali

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: When it was working, it seemed to be working fine. While I don't expect products to last forever, after 3 years, the output is hardly visible. If I go into a dark room, I can barely read it... I expect a product to last more than 3 years. Now I need to find another product.
customer_reviews.author: jimintexas

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've bought for my Mom. She has copd and is on oxygen. Her doctor even approved of this and said its a good one. We bought another so she can have one in two places. Seems to work really well and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Brick

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for monitoring pulse and O2 saturation level. Registers in about 10 seconds or less unless your finger is really cold then won't register at all but I think they are all that way. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Eyrich

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful and Well Designed Gadget!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gadget that seems to work very well. I don’t expect this to be scientifically or medically perfect, and based on data from doctor and hospital visits our experience is this is accurate enough to provide guidance on oxygen saturation trends.
customer_reviews.author: R. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Easy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed. I took it to the Dr office and put it on one finger on my left hand while the nurse checked my stats on the right hand. Not a definitive test but it matched. Both O2 and heart rate. Easy to use and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: J D Dietzen

customer_reviews.title: It works great and the numbers are large and clear for her
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom who suffers from COPD. She loves to have this little unit with her at all times. It works great and the numbers are large and clear for her. I would recommend this product, it does its job and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: boltycrew5👨🏻‍🦲👩🏻‍🦱🧔🏻👩🏼👸🏼

customer_reviews.title: Would absolutely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this device. It is spot on accurate and I will definitely buy again when need be. My only concern is that I didn't see in all the description and product information, any indication that the meter came with a carrying case. As I looked ahead to the frequently bought together part, I noticed a case and purchased it. I received the meter very quickly and was surprised that a carrying case was included. In conclusion, don't buy the extra case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mine included case
customer_reviews.text: The pulse oximeter works very well and Is worth the money. I'm very disappointed with Amazon though because they suggested, under "Frequently bought together", that a case be purchased for the oximeter. I ordered the two items and received the pulse oximeter INCLUDING the case. Nowhere in the copy for the oximeter did it say a case was included. I tried to return the additional case and was told it could not be returned or my money refunded. However, I can return the pulse oximeter within 30 days of purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a few days, and so far, I am very pleased. My Nonin quit after 3 years, not a bad performance, but it cost $80. Even if this only works until the warranty is up, it's still a winner.
customer_reviews.author: RAM

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the home medical kit
customer_reviews.text: Super cool product. I think it maybe reads a point or two below the actual number (e.g., I'm seeing 96-97% readings when I suspect the real number is 98-99%), but it is more than good enough.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read the numbers.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. I have pulmonary hypertension and my breathing levels go down, so I wanted pulse ox at home so I can keep tabs on my breathing. This is easy to read and works right out of the box. Nothing complicated about it.
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with my accU-rate oximeter. I especially like how quickly it gives a reading. It arrived in a timely manner and was actually earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Elpop

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Read Display
customer_reviews.text: Digital display easy to read for older eyes! Easy to set up and use. This high altitude, active elder appreciates this quality product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Merriam

customer_reviews.title: great meter
customer_reviews.text: Works great, only wish it said a case came with it, that would have saved me from buying that also. Great meter though!
customer_reviews.author: redogcamaro

customer_reviews.title: 100% of a deal
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and a great price. I have compared it to the pulse ox monitors at the hospital I work at and it is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It is not 100% accurate (neither is the doctors or hospital). Works great and is portable. The battery last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Avioniks

customer_reviews.title: But still not working good. unable to read
customer_reviews.text: After using 4 months, it goes out of order. I thought, battery goes down. I replaced new batteries. But still not working good. unable to read .
customer_reviews.author: ANAMUL HILALI

customer_reviews.title: As Good as Larger Hospital units
customer_reviews.text: Small, good looking and easy to read, This oximeter is being used both at home and in a cardiac rehab unit.
customer_reviews.author: Wise Owl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Use it every day. Even used it at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: monoped

customer_reviews.title: We will be using this to help monitor my husband’s ...
customer_reviews.text: We will be using this to help monitor my husband’s heart rate and oxygen levels when he is home from ICU. We compared this to their monitors and it was dead on!

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be good quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy to read. I do not know how carefully calibrated it is since I have no comparison instrument.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: A very interesting item and helpful in the monitoring of ones health. Highly recommended!

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for parent who needed it. Home health nurse had the same one.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: As an RN using this device in home health, I can attest that it is reliable and accurate.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: its fine for use indoors or at night, impossible to see in bright sunshine.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to use - I’m a non-medical person. Would have benefitted from brief WRITTEN directions

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! Very easy to users well.

customer_reviews.title: Hypochondriac approved

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

Only negative is that it is not designed to work while exercising. Also, based on the advertisement, I thought I needed to purchase a carrying case separately. The device came with a case and a lanyard.

customer_reviews.title: Being able to show her the difference between having oxygen on and not wearing it is a great motivator for keeping her out of the ER
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my mother who suffers from severe lung issues and must use oxygen continuously. She finds compliance with wearing the oxygen challenging. Being able to show her the difference between having oxygen on and not wearing it is a great motivator for keeping her out of the ER.

customer_reviews.title: I love the ease of use and fit of this monitor

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick information for oxygen and heart rate

The pulse graph shows exactly what is happening in real time. The reading for the oxygen level is also great. You will know instantly if deeper breaths might increase the reading. Great monitor for the healthy and ill. My husband has AFib and if showed in the graph.

customer_reviews.title: It is actually quite inaccurate and the numbers for both ...
customer_reviews.text: It is actually quite inaccurate and the numbers for both the oxygen saturation and pulse rate keep fluctuating even while I am sitting still with the thing on my finger for over 2 minutes. The pulse rate numbers don't stop fluctuating at all and keep cycling between 88 and 113, while it's on my finger and I am sitting absolutely still. I am not sure if I received a defective unit or if it is this brand that is unreliable.

customer_reviews.title: If I could leave less stars, I would. ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could leave less stars, I would. One finger says 97% O2. Another says 72. I try again and it says 84 before blinking out completely. For someone who gets breathing problems and heart palps with her anxiety, this machine can bite me.
customer_reviews.author: L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Display does not show up, I can see the ...
customer_reviews.text: Display does not show up, I can see the light inside but no display!!! You can have this thing back, if you would have provided a phone num I could have contacted you. I also changed batteries, same results

customer_reviews.title: Works Well. Comes with Carrying Case.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Appears to be accurate compared to SpO2 readings I got at the hospital. Please note that this unit does come with a carrying case and lanyard so there is no need to buy a separate carrying case. The seller's product info incorrectly states that the carrying case is sold separately. That may have been true for an earlier version of this product, not sure.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great product - But it came late though
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice product and appears to be accurate. I bought due to the next day shipping, which turned out to be 2 day shipping. Beware of un kept delivery promises. "If you are one of the young and healthy disregard the following comment" The only thing I would change is the black rubber cover that it comes with, to something brighter, lighter, easier to see. Allot of the people that may use this may be old and have bad eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Best pulseox I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have had several other models and by far this is the most sensitive. My fingers do not have adequate blood flow for some of the other similar types. This model is extremely sensitive and picks up the pulse and oxygen level very quickly. Best unit I have ever had, works perfectly every time.
customer_reviews.author: RG0647

customer_reviews.title: Not always accurate
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy is somewhat erratic. Performed many comparisons with expensive Hospital units and sometimes it's within one point, sometimes it's four points out. The one the hospital use cost $500, I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: falbridge

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep an eye on my MIL's oxygen and pulse levels. It works great on everyone but her. It's not the machine's fault but her circulation is so bad it's hit or miss to record it. Nurses and doctors have the same problem with her. The best part is when it does record - it matches the nurses and doctors.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M

customer_reviews.title: Do recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy little gadget. I purchased it without needing one, but put in our first aid kit since it was affordable. It came in very handy later when my wife was diagnosed with lung cancer. It works. Do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: emtgene

customer_reviews.title: Large Bright Display!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother. She is thrilled with the large, bright, easy to read display! It comes with a cord to go around your neck and a nice storage bag to put in someone's purse or bag. It is well worth a few extra dollars! Good job Acc U Rate!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott A

customer_reviews.title: Works great!

customer_reviews.text: Very happy with time of delivery. The device is fantadtic. It has that black rubber outer casing which is very sleek looking and feels grest. I am diabetic and it grips my numb fingers very well. Thank You.

product_meta.title: Zacurate 430-DL Premium Fingertip Pulse Oximeter Oximetry Blood Oxygen Saturation Monitor with Silicon Cover, Batteries and Lanyard
product_meta.description:
After the culmination of more than a thousand feedbacks, we are proud to announce the launch of the Zacurate 430/DL fingertip pulse oximeter. Both the LED and sensor has been improved dramatically and can measures SpO2 (oxygen saturation) and PR (pulse rate) with extreme precision even at low blood perfusion. Just put your finger into the finger chamber and it will measure your SpO2 and PR within seconds. 

How does the plethysmograph work?
Each wave (see above) corresponds to a heart beat and the wave amplitude corresponds to the amount of blood flowing through the blood vessels. If the wave amplitude is low, this means that your blood perfusion is too low for a reliable read. You should retake your measurement and make sure that your finger is positioned right under the LED lights. 

 The 430/DL also retain the dual color OLED rotatable display, allowing you to view your results in any directions. 

Suitable for sports enthusiasts and those who are interested in measuring their SpO2 and PR. WARNING! This is not a medical device! This product should be used for sports and aviation only.

 Acc U Rate and Zacurate are registered trademarks of and exclusively distributed by Med Shop and Beyond. We will actively and aggressively pursue any parties who infringe on our intellectual property rights to the maximum extent allowed by the law. Beware of Imitation, Buy Original.
feature_bullets: ACCURATE AND RELIABLE- The Zacurate 430/DL Pulse oximeter is the premium model of the Zacurate line of pulse oximeters. With a vastly improved LED and sensor, it allows SpO2 (Blood Oxygen Saturation level) and pulse rate measurement even at low blood perfusion.

MEET & EXCEED FDA STANDARDS - Designed for sports enthusiasts like mountain climbers, skiers, bikers or people interested in measuring their SpO2 and pulse rate. In addition, although FDA only requires pulse oximeters to have SpO2 accuracy of ±2%, the 430/DL pulse oximeter barely deviates more than 1% under lab conditions.
ACCOMODATES WIDE RANGE OF FINGER SIZES - Finger chamber with SMART Spring System. Works for ages 12 and above.

LOADED WITH ACCESSORIES - Include 2X AAA BATTERIES that will allow you to use the pulse oximeter right out of the box, a SILICON COVER to protect your pulse oximeter from dirt and damage and a LANYARD for convenience.
18 MONTHS MANUFACTURER WARRANTY - The only pulse oximeter from the Zacurate line with 18 months of manufacturer warranty.
